layer_get_script_end.htm+html.head.title: layer_get_script_end.htm+html.body.p:87-3
layer_get_script_end: This function returns the script function index of the function assigned to run at the end of rendering the given layer, or it will return -1 if no function is assigned. You supply the layer ID (which you get when you create the layer using layer_create()) or the layer name (as a string - this will have a performance impact). You can assign script functions to a layer with layer_script_begin() and layer_script_end().

layer_get_script_end.htm+html.head.title: layer_get_script_end.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:101-9
layer_get_script_end: The unique ID value of the layer to target (or the layer name as a string)

layer_get_script_end.htm+html.head.title: layer_get_script_end.htm+html.body.p:107-3
layer_get_script_end: Script Function Index (Real) or -1 if no script is assigned

layer_get_script_end.htm+html.head.title: layer_get_script_end.htm+html.body.p:113-3
layer_get_script_end: The above code will check to see if the layer that the instance running the code has a script function assigned to it and if it doesn't one is assigned.
